{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":2988266,"name":null,"username":"anon47200102","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/13edae/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-01-10T17:27:26.182Z","cooked":"

My team don’t have an indoor practice space (we have small one car garage), and in the past we have found driving our tank drive and swerve drive drivetrains outside on the concrete results in extremely fast wear of wheels, gears, and to a lesser extent bearings in both systems. We have sds mk2 modules and in the past have used the kop chassis. We are considering switching to the newer gen sds modules but are concerned their billet/thin tread wheels will wear out almost instantly if we run them this way. Are these fears warranted?

What setups have other teams used to get indoor, competition style flooring in outdoors environments?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2022-01-10T17:27:26.182Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":93,"reads":188,"readers_count":187,"score":522.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":399471,"topic_slug":"running-swerve-tank-robots-outside","display_username":null,"primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":47357,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/running-swerve-tank-robots-outside/399471/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":2988270,"name":"James Oosterhouse","username":"TheRealJamesOo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/therealjamesoo/{size}/221396_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-10T17:30:06.963Z","cooked":"

If possible, find some competition (or similar) carpet to roll out when you practice. This will help imitate the practice environment more and prevent the wear and tear you speak of.

For reference, this thread from 2013

Carpet source? Technical Discussion
Where can one obtain FRC carpet? I haven’t been able to find online the type of carpet or where to get it. Is there a source for big dealers like HD, Lowes, and/or is there a standard name/brand for this carpet?

You can also ask around local team to see if they have extra

You could buy a roll of carpet to roll out, there’s a specific carpet that frc uses but I’m not sure about what type.

+1 for trying to source some kind of carpet similar to what you find on the actual field (while the real deal, exact carpet is nice, it’s no means necessary to have the exact same carpet. Something “close enough” will work wonders too).

Depending on the condition of the concrete/floor you’re going to drive on, I would also consider putting some plywood of sorts down. If there is a fair amount of pot holes/large chunks of concrete missing, this will really improve your experience too.

anon47200102:

Are these fears warranted?

Yes.

anon47200102:

What setups have other teams used to get indoor, competition style flooring in outdoors environments?

Carpet pasted to squares of OSB has worked for 449 in the past.
